EFFECT ON COST: The VICEROY tipping change (non-perf to perf) will
increase cost by about 0.10 to 0.12 $/1000 cigs. There will be

design should change on depletion of current tipping.
The VICEROY tipping is used elsewhere, so that design can be
changed upon receipt of the new tipping.

Cigarette specs are identical to KENT MILDS KS CHAR (JAPAN)
except they use longer (30 mm) tipping.

New brand.

Production scheduled for June, 1988.

CAUSES SKIN IRRITATION.

IN CASE OF CONTACT, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH EYES OR SKIN WITH COPIOUS
AMOUNTS OF WATER FOR AT LEAST 15 MINUTES WHILE REMOVING CONTAMINATED

IF INHALED, REMOVE TO FRESH AIR. IF NOT BREATHING GIVE ARTIFICIAL
RESPIRATION, PREFERABLY MOUTH-TO-MOUTH. IF BREATHING IS DIFFICULT.

CALL A PHYSICIAN.

SECTION V - HEALTH HAZARD DATA
Effects of Exposure:
highly toxic, carcinogen
Swallowing May be fatal if swallowed.
Skin absorption: May be fatal if absorbed through skin.
Inhalation: May be fatal if inhaled. Do not inhale dust.
Skin contact: Do not get on skin. Wash thoroughly after handling.
Eye contact: Do not get in eyes.
Emergency and First Aid Procedures:
Swallowing Call a physician immediately.
Skin Flush skin with copious amounts of water for at least 15 min.
Remove contaminated clothing and shoes.
Call a physician.
Inhalation: Move to fresh air. It not breathing give artificial respiration.
Eyes: Flush eyes with copious amounts of water for at least 15 min.
Call a physician.

PRINCIPAL COMPONENT: CHLORINE C.A.S. NO.:
HAZARDOUS MIXTURES OF OTHER LIQUIDS, SOLIDS OR GASES: CHLORINE IS ONE OF
THE CHEMICAL ELEMENTS. THIS SUBSTANCE CAN BE ABSORBED INTO THE BODY
BY INHALATION AND IS CORROSIVE TO THE EYES, SKIN AND RESPIRATORY
TRACT. SERIOUS CASES MAY BE FATAL.
THRESHOLD LIMIT VALUE: ACGIH=1 PPM (8HRS TWA)
OSHA PERMISSIBLE EXPOSURE LIMIT: 0.5 PPM TWA
IARC CARCINOGEN: NOT LISTED
MUTAGENIC: NOT REPORTED
(1988-89 EDITION) 3 PPM STEL
(MARCH 1989)
NTP CARCINOGEN: NOT LISTED
TERATOGENIC: NOT REPORTED
REPRODUCTIVE TOXICITY: STUDIES SHOW NO EFFECTS ON RATS AND RABBITS EXPOSED
TO CHLORINE.
MEDICAL CONDITION(S) AGGRAVATED BY EXPOSURE: EMPHYSEMA, BRONCHITIS, ASTHMA
AND OTHER RESPIRATORY DISEASES.
PRIMARY ROUTES OF EXPOSURE: INHALATION
EFFECTS OF EXPOSURE:
INHALATION: IT AFFECTS THE RESPIRATORY SYSTEM FROM MILD IRRITATION
WITH COUGHING AND LABORED BREATHING TO POSSIBLE DEATH FROM
SUFFOCATION.
SKIN: LIQUID AND GAS ARE CAPABLE OF CAUSING A BURN.
EYES: LIQUID AND GAS ARE CAPABLE OF CAUSING A BURN.
INGESTION: NOT LIKELY A PROBLEM BECAUSE IT IS A GAS AT ROOM TEMPERATURE
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: ONE STUDY WHICH INVOLVED EXPOSURES TO HUMANS TO 0.5
PPM FOR 8 HRS. AND 1.0 PPM FOR 4 HRS. CAUSED TRANSIENT DECREASED PULMONARY
CAPACITY AS MEASURED BY PULMONARY FUNCTION TESTS.
TARGET ORGANS: RESPIRATORY SYSTEM
CHRONIC TOXICITY: RHESUS MONKEYS EXPOSED TO CONCENTRATIONS TO 2 PPM FOR 6
HRS. A DAY, 5 DAYS A WEEK FOR ONE YEAR DID NOT EXHIBIT ANY SIGNS OF
CHRONIC TOXICITY.

Critical Accept/reject criteria,
Typical Monitored for trends, could result in a rejection as a result of machinability problems.
Umits apply to averages of 10 samples tested at random from a pallet or strip
cards representing a pallet for: basis weight, caliper, porosity, tensile, elongation, and opacity.
To obtain valid test results, when samples are obtained from vendor sample
cards, one strip will be selected from each of ten different sample card
positions. If less than ten positions are avalable, each position wo be
sampled at least once and not more than twice per test.
Limits apply to averages of 10 samples tested at random from the lot for citrate.CACO3 and edge tear.
To obtain valid test results, samples must be conditioned/tested using TAPPI T402M.

COMPOUND PHYSICAL PARAMETERS
LAC FILE NUM[SEIN
B164
PHYSICAL STATE
Brownish-gray powder
ELOT REA
The pH of a 50% concentration of B164 in water was theoretically calculated to
be 4.82 at 25°C according to the extrapolation procedure of Dr. P. D. Schickedantz,
Lorillard Research Center Accession Number 1662.
SPECIFIC GRAVITY
not applicable
SOLUBUTY
MUTAGENICITY SOLVENTS
B164 forms a slightly soluble slurry in distilled water at 0.2 g/mL, with stirring,
at room temperature. Reference BC30-62.
°
B164 is insoluble for ip dosing. Reference BC20-48.
ORAL
B164 forms a suspension in corn oil at 0.1 g/mL. with constant stirring. Dosing
volumes of 20 mL/kg or higher may be necessary to achieve desired dosage.
Reference BC20-48.
* Pulverize with mortart pestle before dosing, preparing dosing solutions.
ACUTE CARDIOVASCULAR
B164 in insoluble for this procedure. Reference BC20-48.
STORAGE RECOMMENDATIO
Refrigerate in an amber glass bottle at no more than 8°C.

Ⓒ AUR
HEAT
